intro: Genista lamprophylla, commonly known as the silverleaf broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, often spiny stems and small, leathery leaves that are covered in a silvery-white pubescence. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it adaptable to rocky or coastal environments. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
